name: plugout_drive
author: AFNI Developers
description: This program connects to AFNI and sends commands that the user specifies interactively or on command line over to AFNI to be executed.

inputs.description: Connect to AFNI running on the specified host using TCP/IP. Default is 'localhost'.
inputs.name: Host name

inputs.description: Connect to the current host using shared memory for large data transfers.
inputs.name: Shared memory flag

inputs.description: Use TCP/IP port number. Default is 8099.
inputs.name: Port number

inputs.description: Maximum wait time in seconds for AFNI to connect. Default is 9 seconds.
inputs.name: Max wait time

inputs.description: Name that AFNI assigns to this plugout. Default is a pre-defined name.
inputs.name: Plugout name

inputs.description: Command to be executed on AFNI. Example: '-com "SET_FUNCTION SomeFunction"'.
inputs.name: Commands

inputs.description: Quit after executing all -com commands. Default is to wait for more commands.
inputs.name: Quit

inputs.description: Provide a port offset to allow multiple instances of AFNI <--> SUMA, etc., on the same machine.
inputs.name: Port offset

inputs.description: Like -np but quieter in the face of adversity.
inputs.name: Quiet port offset

inputs.description: Similar to -np, but using a block for easier usage.
inputs.name: Port offset block

inputs.description: Print the current value of MAX_BLOC and exit.
inputs.name: Max port block

inputs.description: Print MAX_BLOC value and exit quietly.
inputs.name: Max port block quiet

inputs.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI and exit.
inputs.name: Number of assigned ports

inputs.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI and exit quietly.
inputs.name: Number of assigned ports quiet
